comments:
I'm running:
Eclipse SDK

Version: 3.3.0
Build id: I20070503-1400

Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools SDK

Version: 4.0.0.200705251830
Build id: 200705251830

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create new Eclipse workspace
2) New > Project... > C++ project; select Executable project type and Cygwin GCC as toolchain, click Finish
3) Right-click on newly created project, select Properties
4) Select C/C++ Build. Now, change the configuration by selecting "Release" from the drop-down
5) Expand C/C++ Build, select Settings; on the Tool settings tab, select Cygwin C++ Compiler
6) Now, change the configuration by selecting "Release" from the drop-down; note that the tab does not get updated.
7) Click Warnings under Cygwin C++ Compiler; now, click Cygwin C++ Compiler again - the NPE gets generated.

It should be noted that this only happens once if the workspace is opened, a new project is created and its properties are checked right away.

Stack trace:
